resources.string: Shikaku
Hello, blank fragment
Hello! My name is WOVEY! I\'ll help you figure out what \'Shikaku\' is!
So, Shikaku is a board game that contains many cells with numbers in them.
Like the example below!
For this tutorial, let\'s use a 2x2 board.
Your job is to divide the board into rectangles.
Each rectangle contains only ONE number.
The number indicates how many cells are contained in the rectangle.
Try to create rectangles in this puzzle by swiping your finger and solve it.
Nice! You\'ve got this!
Now, solve this puzzle!
You\'re a rock! Now you\'re ready to conquer Shikaku!
You\'re wrong! Remember, Each rectangle contains only ONE number and the size of the rectangle matches the number.
Easy
Medium
Hard
This element will help you to know the size of the rectangle that you are creating.
This element will help you to know how long you have been playing.
If you want to get a rest, I got you covered by this button.
When things get messed up, don\'t worry! this button always allows you to get a fresh start.
How to identify wrong rectangles?
If you\'re feeling stuck, you may get a hint by filling the board with rectangles.
"1. The divided square areas must contain a single number indicating the area of the square region.
3. No divided square area should overlap with another divided square area.
2. The area of the divided square must be equal to the number contained within it.
Congratulations! You have conquered the puzzle in
